intro: Micromeria cypria, commonly known as the Cyprus micromeria, is a small, annual herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, with narrow, linear leaves and small yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
